headline.main: Our Fliers in Long-Range Raid Hit 2 Japanese Ships Off New Ireland; OUR FLIERS IN RAID OFF NEW IRELAND HEIGHTENING ACTION IN NEW GUINEA AREA

lead_paragraph: SOMEWHERE IN AUSTRALIA, Saturday, April 3 -- American heavy bombers struck at a concentration of shipping off Kavieng, New Ireland, at dusk Thursday in one of the biggest long-range air attacks carried out in the Southwest Pacific for some time, today's Allied Headquarters communique revealed.
abstract: US planes attack 13 Jap ships near Kavieng; 2 ships believed hit; Jap activity, New Guinea area, studied; hundreds of Jap survivors from convoys smashed in Bismarck Sea reptd taken by Australian patrols, Goodenough and Trobriand Islands; map
